page.title: 11GARTREE PRISON_FOXTON
page.content: H.M.Prison Gartree was opened as a category C prison in 1966.It was built on a former R.A.F.airfield. In 1972 it became a maximum security prison.This meant that with the construction of a wall and the addition of close circuit T.V.cover +dog patrols Gartree was equipped to hold some of Britain's most notorious criminals. The current population is 304 including 47 "high risk"prisoners.Over a third of the total population are serving Life sentences. The prison has its own education block,hospital,workshops,playing fields,gymnasium and church.Each inmate has a single cell.Indeed apart from no freedom inmates do have a better standard of life than some people outside the wall.
